citations.narrative:
Six adult male (ID numbers 001, 054, 074, 124, 126, and 900235000509175) and nine adult female (ID numbers 002,
055, 057, 085, 097, 098, 249, 250 and 251) Jack Russell terriers did not receive a veterinary examination within the last
12 months.
Veterinary examinations are important for preventive care as well as detection of existing physical or behavioral problems;
delayed examinations can result in failure to prevent, diagnose or treat issues, which can have a negative impact on the
health and well being of the animals. The licensee must ensure that every dog receives a complete physical examination
from head to tail by the attending veterinarian not less than once every 12 months.
TO BE CORRECTED BY FEBRUARY 1, 2024

Six adult male (ID numbers 001, 054, 074, 124, 126, and 900235000509175) and nine adult female (ID numbers 002,
055, 057, 085, 097, 098, 249, 250 and 251) Jack Russell terriers did not receive annual vaccinations for Bordetella as
outlined in the Program of Veterinary Care approved by the Attending Veterinarian.
Timely examinations, vaccinations and screening for heartworm and other parasites are important parts of the Program of
Veterinary Care; deviation from this plan can result in failure to prevent, diagnose or treat issues that can have a negative
impact on the health and well being of the animals. The licensee must ensure that all vaccinations and sampling for
heartworm and other parasites are completed as required per the Program of Veterinary Care approved by the Attending
Veterinarian.
TO BE CORRECTED BY FEBRUARY 1, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs.

Veterinary examinations are important for preventive care as well as detection of existing physical or behavioral problems;

health and well being of the animals. The licensee must ensure that every dog receives a complete physical examination 
from head to tail by the attending veterinarian not less than once every 12 months. 
TO BE CORRECTED BY FEBRUARY 1, 2024 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Six adult male (ID numbers 001, 054, 074, 124, 126, and 900235000509175) and nine adult female (ID numbers 002,

Timely examinations, vaccinations and screening for heartworm and other parasites are important parts of the Program of

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
